thread.title: Frank Lampard says Antonio Conte could achieve something at Chelsea that Jose Mourinho never could – and that John Terry will always be a Blues legend… unless he joins Spurs
thread.title_full: Frank Lampard says Antonio Conte could achieve something at Chelsea that Jose Mourinho never could – and that John Terry will always be a Blues legend… unless he joins Spurs

author: ashilton
title: Frank Lampard says Antonio Conte could achieve something at Chelsea that Jose Mourinho never could – and that John Terry will always be a Blues legend… unless he joins Spurs
text:
Comments FRANK LAMPARD believes Antonio Conte could achieve something that Jose Mourinho never did – a Chelsea legacy. 
Retired Blues midfield legend Lamps played under ten bosses during his 13 years at Stamford Bridge. Getty Images Conte gets his point across at Chelsea training on Friday Reuters 7 Frank Lampard – with the ‘outstanding contribution to London football award’– gave his verdict on Conte and John Terry 
There were plenty of trophies added to the cabinets, but few managers have been able to leave a lasting imprint on the club. Keep up to date with ALL the Chelsea news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
John Terry has been there since day one of Lampard’s time at Chelsea . 
And the club’s record scorer believes JT will be a club legend… as long as he does not sign for Tottenham! 
Lampard reckons that Conte could now manage the same feat. Getty Images John Terry and Diego Costa at Chelsea training today Getty Images 7 Terry shows his has lost none of his competitive edge with a tackle of Eden Hazard 
He told the Standard : “Could he build a dynasty? He has definitely got the attributes, so you would look at him now and say yes — but who knows what the future holds? 
“It depends on how he feels, how the club feels and how the future pans out. I am very happy with him and if he carries on the way he is, he will stay there for a long time. 
“We hope that will happen. What he is doing at the moment is fantastic. 
“It is very hard to look too far forward in football, but what he is doing is a great thing for the club because last year there was a lot of negative talk and he changed that very quickly. Long may it continue. 
“I don’t like to tempt fate because I am a Chelsea man, but I can’t see them being caught with the gap they have and the way they are playing.” 
“It is a nice situation, you are top of the league and some games you are winning comfortably, you can give some players time, but at the same time it doesn’t have to be the case. He could concentrate on the moment. Related stories Manchester United vs Bournemouth team news: Henrikh Mkhitaryan not likely to start despite return Snod in the dock Robert Snodgrass issued arrest warrant for failing to turn up to court over baby in car charges KARREN BRADY It's looking bad for our neighbours Leyton Orient MISS ME? Tony Pulis has last laugh at ex-club Crystal Palace by claiming Eagles have been big-money flops since he quit To be or not to be? What to expect if Craig Shakespeare is chosen to replace Claudio Ranieri as Leicester boss COR! STRIKER LIGHT Aitor Karanka ready to axe Boro's top scorer and turn to the striker with the worst winning record in Prem 
“People talk about a manager’s lifespan being two years so why should you worry about 18-year-olds. 
“But from seeing Conte bringing young players in, incorporating them into the training squad, showing faith in them… I know the work that is being done in the academy and they deserve that. 
“They deserve those lads being given time so let’s hope some of them push through and really become top players.” Reuters Conte poses with the Manager of the Year award at the London Football Awards 
Blues look destined for the title, sat ten points clear at the top of the Premier League . 
But Terry has had to watch much of the season from the bench and could be looking for a move to another Prem club this summer. 
His pal reckons there is only one club he could go to that would affect his status in the minds fans. PA:Press Association Terry and Lampard celebrate during their hugely successful stint in west London 
Lampard added: “I know whatever he does, unless he signs for Tottenham, he’ll be a legend! 
“He wouldn’t do that but he needs to make his decision now whether that is play in the Premier League, go abroad, go into management. 
“It’s his decision and I think every Chelsea fan will respect that.” PA:Press Association Lampard is Chelseas record scorer after breaking Bobby Tambling’s Blues record John Terry and Frank Lampard do a hilarious staring competition on 'Play to the Whistle'
